thread.title: Jessica Camacho Talks Gypsy's Costume on The Flash
thread.title_full: Jessica Camacho Talks Gypsy's Costume on The Flash

author: Adam Barnhardt
title: Jessica Camacho Talks Gypsy's Costume on The Flash
text:
Jessica Camacho Talks Gypsy's Costume on The Flash Adam Barnhardt Tweet This 
Viewers of The Flash were served up a little treat last week as they were introduced to Cynthia "Cindy" Reynolds, perhaps better known as the metahuman Gypsy , in the show's waning moments. 
We don't have too many details about Gypsy's upcoming appearance on The Flash other than the fact that she hails from Earth-19 and can travel across dimensions. We also know that being a metahuman is a dream come true, at least according to Jessica Camacho, the actress who portrays Reynolds/Gypsy in the Arrowverse. Not only that, Camacho seems to be a big fan of Gypsy's costume on The Flash as well. 
"Yeah, man, let me tell you it holds you back from reaching for that cupcake at lunch," Camacho joked with Comicbook.com. "You're like 'Maybe I'll just have a couple of almonds instead.' I was so excited! I can't think of very many more exciting experiences as an actor. For me, putting on a superhero suit, being a metahuman, is a dream come true." 
While Gypsy was only seen briefly at the end of last week's episode in apparent pursuit of Harrison Wells, tonight's episode is set to explore Gypsy more in-depth and see her in action in her full outfit. 
"When I saw her badassery and her jacket and I suited up for the first time and saw what Gypsy looked like, it was a whole other level of joy and excitement and I just wanted to bring life to that," Camacho said. "I was completely enthralled by it. I will say, a corset may or may not be involved with the jacket, but it’s worth it!” 
The Flash airs Tuesdays at 8 p.m. ET/PT, followed by DC's Legends of Tomorrow at 9 p.m.
